result.name: pre-work_programme_employment_support_measures
result.notes:
From May 2012 this publication will be replaced by 2 new publications under the titles ‘Get Britain Working Measures’ and ‘Mandatory Programmes’. 
This publication ended in November 2016. Publication of on-going statistics on skills conditionality is now reported under ‘Employment Schemes’.

https://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http://research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd1/pwp/index.php?page=pwp

https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/pre-work-programme-and-get-britain-working

Source agency: Work and Pensions

Designation: Official Statistics not designated as National Statistics

Language: English

Alternative title: Pre-WP

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Pre-Work Programme Employment Support Measures
